alert.note: Alert for Hart (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 6:17PM EST until January 03 at 10:38PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Green River at Munfordville affecting Hart County. Green River at Woodbury affecting Butler and Warren Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Green River at Munfordville. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Water enters city park under US 31W bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM CST Saturday the stage was 19.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 33.9 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 34.1 feet on 02/25/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. If you are affected by these crests take any necessary actions. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index. php?wfo=lmk Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued as forecast updates become available.
